name: Residence Inn Fort Myers Sanibel

reviews.text: From making the reservation thru checkout the hotel was very accommodating. My only negative comment is that the rooms felt a bit cramped. Location was good for visiting local beaches including Sanibel island.
reviews.title: Very good value, service, and location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was definitely value for money - its not 5 star and doesnt advertise as 5 star but for the price it was more than expected. The atmosphere is relaxed and staff are extremely helpful - we happen to mention that we had made a booking for transport to an island with no facilities - the reception staff couldnt have been more helpful providing us with a couple of deck chairs and a small cool box to make our trip more comfortable - apparently these items had previously been left by other guests. The hotel rooms are actually juniour suites and were spacious - a fully equipped kitchen, dining area and lounge area, large bedroom with two queen beds and vanity sink area and bathroom. We even had a balcony but not all rooms have that. And we had a room that faced west and could watch the sun go down. But you actually dont want to be on the balcony at sun-up or sun-down as wee midgie things come out that they call no-see-ums and thats why you see so many bug nets over windows and outside doors. Clean towels were replaced as often as required. Beach towels are available to sign for and exchange for fresh each day. Also plentiful adequate breakfast - everything self-service -make your own waffles, fresh fruit, nuts, yoghurt, bagels, and some hot food such as scrambled egg, streaky bacon, or savoury scones that they call biscuits filled with burgers which they called sausage which were very tasty. On Tuesdays and Wednesdays they even had an early evening welcome for guests - from 5pm to 7pm - lemonade and burgers or meatballs or something small and hot was available just to help yourself. A Publix supermarket is in the same complex as the hotel so excellent location to pick up lunch/ freshly made rolls etc. The hotel was for us very conveniently located. We spent most days on Sanibel Island which was just about 6 miles to the centre of the island or about 15 mins from the hotel - it was around 30 mins to the north of Captiva island but we didnt go in rush hour - busy times coming back from the island are between 4 and 6 pm so try and avoid that as the journey is nose to tail with traffic and on the island there are stricty adhered to speed limits of 20/30/40 miles an hour. Shopping malls include Tanger Outlets just across the road from the hotel, Edison Malls with Macys/Dillards/JCPenny about 30 mins drive away and a huge Miromar Outlets about 40 mins drive which although bigger for us was not much better than Tanger outlets across the road. There is a small pool and sunbathing area but we didnt use it - mainly full of kids/families. The guests were international although no British voices were heard. This is a quiet hotel -there was also free WIFI and a couple of computers for guest use if you didnt have your own. If you are after party atmosphere/night life - this hotel is not for you (for that you would be better to go to Fort Myers Beach resort area - again about 30 mins away - neon lights and bars everywhere). A couple of nice restautants that we went to included Captains House at Tween Waters Inn Captiva with grand piano/ starched linen/pianist and The Lighthouse just at the entrance to the causeway - very good - smart casual elegant - near the marina. We would definitely stay here again - it was good value as we had booked the hotel/flight/car hire package through expedia -we had everything we needed and more - and the location was great for us.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic! I am a stickler for a good hotel room. The hotel was clean, the room was clean, comfortable, up to date, well kept, beds were very comfortable. The kitchen amenities were great with a full kitchen. If we had stayed longer we would have used it more. The daily breakfast was awesome, more than I expected. Abundant offerings of cold items, rolls, bagels, english muffins, fruit, with yogurt and granola. Juice, coffee and tea, and pour your own waffle maker. The hot items were more than I have had at a hotel recently. Egg bake along with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits with grave and the choices changed daily for variety! Big thumbs up on the first meal of the day to be ready for each daily adventure. The hotel is a 5 minute ride if that to the Sanibel Causway. We went to the island every day and loved the conveniance of the close hotel. Any other hotel in North Ft Myers would have been a serious hike to the beach. It was a great option to avoid the extra $$ to actually stay on Sanibel for a great hotel minutes from the beach.
reviews.title: Would return in a heartbeat!

reviews.text: This is hotel is only 5-6 miles to Sanibel on Summerlin Rd. It's next to a Publix and across from a Tanger outlet, so the location is great! I was there for the Red Sox, as well as the beach. Hammond Stadium, home of the Twins is very easy to get to from here, and it's not difficult to get to City of Palms. There is a nice pool with a hot tub here, and an expanded breakfast, including eggs and sausage/bacon. A good value for the money, especially at the height of the season. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Convenient yet quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spotless clean, large rooms .But you need a car and lots of gas to go around. although it is very close to Sanibel and the beaches. Photos on the website portray the reality. Front desk very helpful,
reviews.title: all in all, a good hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was clean, nice and new. The stafff was friendly. The breakfast was a bargain. It worked well since I was working in N Naples and my family was going to Sanibel. I would stay away from the Gator Restaurant in the Publix Plaza. Too pricey and the food was super fried.
reviews.title: Great New Hotel in Good Location for Sanibel and Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on 04/29/2011 throught 05/01/2011 we had a great time, the staff was just wonderfull, and helpfull.....the room was picture perfect, very clean, and cozy.
reviews.title: GREAT PRICE, GREAT LOCATION, & GREAT SERVICE

reviews.text: They do seve a hot breakfast, and it was very nice, they do change it up a bit, which was great. Anything we requested......the staff was right there to accommodate, no questions ask. We were close to Sanibel Island, and Captiva, shopping, restaurants.
reviews.title: Best value with superior customer service.

reviews.text: I couldn't find one single thing that was wrong. And I looked. TRUST ME.!!!!!
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff could facilitate seminars on customer service. The hotel is a great value, it's clean, the rooms are well appointed with nice decor and appliances. Location, location, location... Takes only 7 minutes to get from hotel to islands.
reviews.title: Super Value for the $$

reviews.text: We stayed here one night in a two bedroom two bath suite. We were a party of two couples. I booked this hotel due to its location to Sanibel and its value. The room was $99 a night. The rooms were very comfy and clean. The unexpected surprise was the well stocked kitchen and the Publix supermarket right next door. The eating options in Ft. Myers aren't the best. We used the kitchen and the supermarket to enjoy a luxurious home cooked meal. Though I didn't use it, the pool and the hot tub looked nice too. The location to Sanibel is great, only five minutes away. I would stay here again in a second and highly recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Unexpectedly Good

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and the breakfast was good. What we didn`t like was the plastic plates and the cutlery. Hyatt place and Cambria Suitesdoes it much better with there tableware.The roome was clean but the hotel it self was not. In the dining room was the wallpaper in one corner fallen off and this after the short time the hotel is open. I`m wondering about..
reviews.title: I`m not sure.

reviews.text: Well the hotel is new and nice now but I hope they will it keep it in good condition.
reviews.title: great new hotel..great decor...nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was clean and had beautiful decor. It opened in Sept 2009 and is being kept nice and clean! The hot breakfast was a hit with the kids and adults. Pool area is very nice with a hot tub and plenty of chase and sitting chairs. The front desk staff was freindly and answered any questions. Rooms and hallways were quiet, guest laundry was available with coin operations. Kitchen has full fridge, stovetop, micro and dishwasher. Publix grocery is across the parking lot for excellent options for quick meals.
reviews.title: I can see why this hotel is popular

reviews.text: We had a 2 queen bed, request one with a balcony for a nice view of the pool or nearby wilderness.
reviews.title: Nice, new hotel. Front desk could use some work.

reviews.text: The 2-bedroom suite was PERFECT for my husband and I, with our young daughter (not quite 2 years old), along with my parents. Off each side of the lovely kitchen/living room there are 2 separate bedrooms, each with their own bathroom, complete with shower and bathtub, which allowed for privacy and efficiency in getting out the door in the mornings!
reviews.title: I can't wait to go back on another family trip!

reviews.text: The buffet breakfasts were FABULOUS - my favourite is the make-your-own Belgium Waffles (which you can cover with whipped cream and fresh fruit!), but there was also juice, scrambled eggs, sausage or ham, yogurt, fruit, cereal, etc. It was great! There were also 3 evening events while we were there that provided food (a St. Patty's Day meal with corned beef, mashed potatoes, veggies, and dessert!), a chili night, and an "appetizer/dessert" event that could have easily been your meal (nice cheeses and crackers, salad, fruit salad, and desserts...!) The staff went out of their way to provide great food!
reviews.title: This hotel was great, except for....

reviews.text: We LOVED the WARM POOL (heated - not just by the sunshine!) and whirlpool. We were all in swimming every day. We also had fun playing with volleyballs/basketballs (provided at the front desk) on the small court outside.
reviews.title: A Home Run - almost

reviews.text: This hotel is across the road from the Tanger Outlets, and beside a Publix. We bought groceries several times at the Publix, and made some of our own meals in the fully-equipped kitchen. This was really convenient, and a great time and money-saver over restaurant meals!
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk people were VERY helpful, whether it be providing directions (they have pre-printed cards for restaurants, theatres, tourist attractions, etc.), or giving opinions on fun activities for a 2-year-old in the rain! (The new library within easy driving distance is a great choice!)
reviews.title: Loved this Place!

reviews.text: We got a room with a king sized bed (extremely comfortable) and a sofa bed. Our teenaged son slept on the sofa bed. It is truly very uncomfortable-very thin mattress-and actually the couch itself was a little uncomfortable-we had to put the sofa cushion onto of the mattress so he could sleep. Otherwise, the hotel had a great location, great service and was very clean. However, unless your traveling with little ones, don't get a room with a sofa bed.
reviews.title: Only one complaint, the sofa bed is very uncomfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow - One bedroom suite was like living at home! - Breakfast is excellent in nice bright sitting area. Across highway from Tanger Outlets - great shopping. Publix in adjacent parking lot. With our full kitchen - we ate in for a change on our vacation. Overall - great experience.
reviews.title: Best Residence Inn - so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first stay at a Residence Inn but if it's typical, I'll be staying at many more in my travels. We booked a two-bedroom suite. Each had its own bathroom and other amenities. The unit had a nice living room and full kitchen. Not only that, but Housekeeping washed the dishes and the hotel offered to shop for groceries for you. Breakfasts were free and ample -- and very crowded. Many people took their food up to their rooms. Two or three nights a week the hotel threw a party for guests, with food and soft drinks. The hotel sits next to a great Publix supermarket and is across the street from a Tanger Factory Outlet Mall. The causeway to Sanibel Island is just down the road. My only complaint was that there was no pay-per-view movie channel on the tv. The cable gives you about 30-some channels (including several HBO channels) but if you want to watch non-HBO movies, you can't. There's not much to do there at night time, so the movie channel was sorely missed. Bring books. We had a wonderful week-long stay, thanks in no small measure to this fine hotel.
reviews.title: Almost a Perfect Hotel Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice common areas done in tropical colors of the sea and Florida landscape. Rooms
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel - tropical design unlike most Residence Inns

reviews.text: very comfortable with new design. Front desk staff not that friendly. Good breakfast with
reviews.title: Great location and convenient

reviews.text: I decided to stay here for a 4-day trip to Sanibel and would not hesitate to return! I booked a suite with 2 queen beds for $104 with a AAA discount (a single was only $84). The furnishings and appliances were very contemporary and surprisingly nice (except for the sheets which were a little rough) and the proximity to the beaches of Fort Myers and Sanibel could not be beat. The actual living space is fairly tight but you will probably not be spending much time in the room. The balcony off the living room was useful for lounging and hanging wet swimming suits and towels to dry (although watch for biting insects in the evening, as in anywhere in FL)! Our room looked exactly like the photos on the Marriott website (no surprises). The bathroom was clean and well-stocked, with toiletries refreshed daily, but the grouting was a little cracked and the towel holders had some rust marks. The Publix supermarket across the street was very handy for buying snacks and sunblock, bug spray, etc. The free breakfast buffet included cereals and breads, muffins, waffle stations, eggs, sausage, granola, fresh fruit, juice, coffee, etc. and was well-stocked. The location was a great base to explore Fort Myers, go kayaking in Tarpon Bay, catch some rays and collect shells in Sanibel/Captiva, and go shopping at the nearby outlets. The front desk was very friendly and helpful in providing advice. The free wi-fi was good and the pool, while small, was very clean and provided some cool relief after a hot day. All in all, this hotel provided excellent value and I would happily return for another stay!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Our stay was short but the experience was perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - a fair price;
reviews.title: Wonderful, This manager knows how to run a Hotel

reviews.text: - very friendly and helpfull staff!!!!;
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - a new, spacious and clean room;
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at this Residence Inn. We have stayed at many Residence Inns and this one matched our expectation as it relates to the rooms (two bedroom) and the location. We liked being on a higher floor where we could see the Gulf, and the places we had visited during the day.
reviews.title: Great Rooms and Great Location!

reviews.text: We thought the staff were a bit sharp, and not very helpful. The breakfast was ok, but not up to the standard of other Residence Inns that we have stayed at.
reviews.title: One of the best Residence Inns

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd probably look for another place to stay if we visited the area again.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really nice hotel with a great location. Associates were friendly, helpful, and able to provide directions and suggestions. Public space is clean and well kept. Free breakfast was very good with a few different items everyday. Loved the spacious 2 bedroom suite that I shared with my kids. Really close to Ft. Myers beach and Sanibel Island. Outlets across the street were good on a cloudy morning while we waited for the sun to come out. Grocery store next to hotel.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel and nicely located

reviews.text: This was our fifth year coming to this Residence Inn and it is always wonderful. Every desk attendant we spoke to was helpful and pleasant (thank you, Katy, Cheryl, and Margarita!!), the breakfast room manager was delightful (thank you, Shannon!!), and the breakfast attendants were very efficient at replacing items and keeping the room immaculate. The entire staff could not have been nicer. The breakfast offerings are very varied and always included scrambled eggs, a meat, a potato, and another offering such as French toast or breakfast sandwiches plus fresh fruit, make-your-wn waffles, yoghurt, oatmeal, cold cereal, etc, etc. We never needed lunch. Light dinners are offered two weekdays and we really enjoyed the bbq sandwiches and salads when we arrived tired on our first day in Florida. We had reserved a one bedroom suite but, since a tour group had all the one bedrooms, we were upgraded to a two bedroom for our entire stay. We had requested a suite on a high floor overlooking the marshlands and we were given a two bedroom with the exact view we requested. The suite was immaculate, the maid service was excellent, the bed was comfortable, and we loved having a full kitchen where we could prepare dinner when we wished. The hotel is in a quiet area of Ft. Myers with minimal traffic, but next to a small center with a grocery and across the street from a Tanger outlet that is landscaped and set back from the road to maintain the quiet atmosphere. Fifteen minutes from lots of great restaurants and an easy drive to rt. 75 and Naples. We can't wait to come back next year!!!
reviews.title: Wow, value! Wow, accomodations! Wow, breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a number of reasons I didn't care for this place. I really did like the way it was decorated - nicely done. But that's about where the good part ended. For a suite, this was the smallest unit I've ever been in. The pillows were uncomfortable - and they didn't even have a plastic dry cleaning bag in the closet which is standard for hotels. The front desk was so unhelpful. They didn't have any recommendations when I asked about a fishing excursion. They suggested I drive and look down a street that has signs and pick one. What hotel does that? Also, when I tried to print my boarding pass, it wouldn't work. After several unsuccessful attempts, I went to the front desk. She told me to try again and if it didn't work she'd come over to help. Again, who does that? Of course, I tried again and it didn't work. She didn't come over but instead had me use the computer in her office, which did work. It didn't look like the fire pit was working (didn't bother to ask about it). When I asked about the tennis courts (which are mini), I was give a lukewarm response too.
reviews.title: Nicely decorated but unimpressed

reviews.text: Breakfast was complementary and a lot of people came down every morning. It was your standard buffet with plastic plates, cups, and silverware. Nothing special. It's a short drive to Fort Myers Beach or Sanibel Island but not many restaurants right near the hotel. The outlet mall is directly across the street.
reviews.title: Great Place-Would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many hotels available in the area that I wouldn't ever consider coming back even though it does have a fresh new look. It makes me realize how important the service of front line staff is, and combined with other small details, they can make or break your hotel experience.
reviews.title: Great Stay !!!

reviews.text: This hotel was terrific. We had a wonderfully appointed little suite. Great little kitchenette and lounging room with separate bedroom. It was very nicely decorated (trendy) and clean. Beds were very comfy too. The breakfast was very good with plenty of options and continued hot food was put on the buffet. There was staff cleaning tables and asking to take away items we were finished with. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean. The public areas were open and airy with lots of windows. The hotel was conveniently located to shopping and the entrance bridge to Sanibel. We would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Perfect for family

reviews.text: Just returned from a 6 night stay. Great experience. ALL the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Room was perfect for us with the separate bedroom. Beds were very comfortable and flipped the fan to on so never heard a thing. Pool was heated just right, very comfortable even for an evening swim. Never got tired of the breakfast spread.... scrambled eggs, meat, potatoes and a specialty item each day ie. breakfast sandwich, make your own pancakes, oatmeal, cereals, fruits, yogurt....just say that you couldn't go away hungry. Tuesday and Wednesday evening events, meatloaf one night and bbq'd chicken the other. Staff was friendly and helpful. Steered us to several nearby restaurants. Gator Bites across the parking lot was a hit. Even the gator bites tho they had 'normal food' also. Lighthouse wharf just a mile down road towards Sanibel was delicious for our last dinner, Grilled grouper ...mmmm!!! Husband's prime rib was best he's had in awhile and we're from beef country, Nebraska. All in all.... we would return and stay again !!!
reviews.title: Very nice option for Sanibel

reviews.text: Warm friendly service. Always greeted with a smile. Clean & modern rooms. A brand new hotel and staff made every attempt to please! Very happy with stay and would recommend to family and friends.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a grest introductory rate of $69 for a 1BR suite. Very nice hotel. They are having some problems, especially with an elevator. We were there for 1 week and this elevator was out of service more than it was working. At least they were very responsive in getting a service man to try to fix it, but it kept going out of service. At least you can't blame the hotel for this. Also the Discovery channel was 'no signal for 3 days but they finally got someone in to fix that. Waiting to see what their regular rates will be.
reviews.title: It's open but has growing pains.

reviews.text: They are still experimenting with what they serve for the 3 night manager's reception. They don't have their liquor licence yet.
reviews.title: Very modern, clean and convenient location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to the beach. Great location for us beach walkers.
reviews.title: Marriott's newest gem in SW Florida

reviews.text: This is our first stay in this inn which opened just 2 weeks prior to our arrival. The check-in was pleasant and easy. We were greeted by nice people in the front desk. The room we stayed in was in the 2nd floor with nice balcony and view of the pool. The room was very clean with pleasant smell and ambiance. The nice size room with 2 queens had a separate door from the living room and kitchen. It had a nice size shower, vanity and closet. The room looked very romantic at night with the available lightings. New pillow-top beds came with nice clean sheets and pillows were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Not open but charge the credit card

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close but not close enough, its new and that is about it, and the comp breakfast is pretty good. There is restaurant adjacent to hotel called "Biddles" don't go there - not worth it. Its a little misleading as the word Sanibel is listed in its name, you still need to get on the island over a $6 toll, about 5 to 10 minute ride, and about a 20 min ride to fort myers. The gym is like all the other residence inns, adequate as is the pool...our bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Close to Sanibel Island and Fort Myers Beach
Fresh, "Upscale" Residence Inn - great location
reviews.text: Wow! Huge bright colorful lobby and breakfast room - the rooms have beautiful kitchens, granite all over the place. Incredibly friendly at check-in with all kinds of local recommendations. One of the long tables in the breakfast room is a tall (with stools) shared table with outlets for laptops. Great hot breakfast. Surprising and fun; wonderful location--walk through the parking lot to Publix and Biddles restaurant. Causeway to Sanibel, Outlet stores, Ft Myers Beach. Loved it.

I initially chose to book here as I got a great rate and am not overly needy regarding fancy resort style amenities, etc. but I would go back in a heart beat even without the "great rate" as the building is brand new and the staff is beyond friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a full compliment of eggs, make it yourself waffles, pancakes or potatoes or if you prefer granola, oatmeal or dry cereal and fruit.
reviews.title: Would simply move in if I could!
Fab choice!
reviews.text: My suite was fully equipped for cooking and dining made more enjoyable by the large (42" maybe) flat screen TV that was mounted on a lazy susan on the bureau which functions as room divider between living and sleeping areas. Swiveling the lazy susan provided perfect viewing from all areas of the suite.
Did I mention the staff was wonderful? Every one I encountered had a smile and if asked a quesiton they either knew the answer or went and looked into for me.
reviews.title: Great place, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during the new year holiday. The location is great for people to visit Sanibel island. It's right across from the outlet mall, and also inside the area, there's a supermarket. So in terms of location, we really like it.
reviews.title: Very convenient location to visit Sanibel island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious. It's not fancy but it's comfortable. The staff is helpful. The morning breakfast had a great selection.
reviews.title: Convenient Residence Inn at the Gateway to Sanibel Island

reviews.text: Overall, it's a good place to stay.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Residence Inn for four days, December 18-22, 2012. The hotel was convenient to the Sanibel Causeway, shopping, and other services. The drive from Southwest Florida International Airport was direct and easy. We were staying for a brief, leisurely break before Christmas, trying to catch some good weather and a change of pace from work and the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy in New Jersey, with an eight-day blackout and no heat. The hotel was comfortable, clean, and welcoming. We reserved a one-bedroom unit, and the staff gave us a two-bedroom, two-bathroom suite with a full kitchen and living room area. The kitchen had full-size appliances and enough kitchenware to make meals, which we always do because of dietary issues and preferences. The hotel was clean and pleasant. They provided a complimentary full breakfast every day with plenty of good choices and a large, sunny, clean dining area with friendly staff who circulated among the tables, offering extra coffee and picking up remnants from meals. They even had a variety of themed late-afternoon/early evening get-togethers with light food during the week. The base cost of the room we reserved was only $109.00 per night, the price for a single-bedroom suite, and they gave us the upgrade at no extra charge. I realize that we stayed there off season, but we still appreciate the perks.
reviews.title: I don't like being lied to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like Sanibel and Captiva Islands, and the hotel was situated very close to the causeway, which made driving easy. The hotel is located near a strip mall with a Publix supermarket, a gas station, and other stores and services. Across the main road were outlets with a variety of stores. Even though we were near a strip mall, we had a nice view to the west over tidal flats where we could see wading birds feeding in the distance, and the Sanibel Lighthouse light was visible each night.
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from Dec 12 - 19, 2012. Accommodating hotel staff. There was an 'evening dinner' served the first night we checked in. The room was great, breakfast was very good with a lot of food to choose from - scrambled eggs with ham or sausage and potatoes plus something else (grits, eggs benedict), many good juices, fruit, fantastic bread, bagels, many types of yogurt and a waffle station. The pool was great and the hot tub even better. It was a 1-2 minute walk to a Publix, Subway, liquor store and a restaurant called Gator Bites (so-so). The hotel is located just across the road from a great Tanger Factory Outlet mall and I spent a few afternoons having a great time shopping. Sanibel is literally just down the road over a bridge. We were centrally located to many golf clubs and took advantage of that. I would recommend this hotel and we are now planning on making this an annual trip. Will definitely stay at this hotel again next year.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: We will be coming to this location for my mother’s birthday weekend Jan. 2013, and already not so happy. I called the front desk today to ask (If they did anything for an extra charge for birthdays or any kind of decorations in the room), was told no and they hung up on me. Well not off to a good start. I guess I can get some flowers and decorations and go up to the room why my mom waits in the lobby. Just a little disappointed that this is the Marriott and have never been treated this way from this brand..
reviews.title: Jan 12 to 14 2013

reviews.text: Very good location, across from a small outlet mall, near a grocery store, and about 5-10 minutes drive to either Sanibel Island or Fort Myers Beach, two very different scenes. The lobby seemed a bit dated in places. But the friendly staff and overall cleanliness made up for the tired honeydew green decor in the common areas. The room (ours was a 2 bedroom) was spacious and had a view towards the Gulf of Mexico in the distance. A balcony would have been nice. The kitchen had full sized appliances. Some of the furniture was a bit worn. The beds were comfortable. The included breakfast buffet had plenty of good choices including eggs, waffles and at least one meat. Overall a very good option, and a bargain compared to the hotels on Sanibel. It's worth paying a few dollars to cross the bridge to the island.
reviews.title: Good Sanibel and Fort Myers Beach Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beauty of Residence Inn is staying in hotel with all the amenities of home! It was perfect for our week vacation exploring the Fort Myers & Sanibel Island area. This property is well maintained with updated rooms, kitchenette, dining table, living room area, work desk, bedroom, bathroom and we opted for a room with balcony view. We had GREAT sunset watching each night with our balcony on the top floor! They have a nice pool area (with a hot tub), fire pit area, basketball court, and even bikes you can rent by the hour. The staff was very helpful especially Tim a Manager. Tim kindly saved us money from going out to buy beach chairs - offering us to borrow one of many beach chairs kindly left behind by previous guest for others to borrow. The breakfast area offers a large selection of items served each morning and on several evenings they offered additional meal options. We packed light for our trip and opted to do laundry mid-week in the laundry facility on-site. We used the workout room and business area too. There is a shopping plaza next door (you can walk) to a grocery store, liquor store, Subway restaurant (easy to-go picnic lunches), and even a fun sports bar/restaurant called "Gator Bites". If you want to shop the Tanger Outlets are directly across the street and you could walk or drive over. There are LOTS of beach options in nearby Fort Myers and Sanibel Island (we explored several) including one beach very close to the hotel if you don't feel like traveling too far or paying toll to cross over to Sanibel Island. If you would like to learn about restaurant, ice cream, and beach recommendations please read my other post for Fort Myers & Sanibel Island area.
reviews.title: Great hotel if visitng Fort Myers & Sanibel Island!

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel across the bridge from Sanibel. Great sunset view across the street for outlet mall. Rooms are huge. Breakfast was excellent. I was there for a manager night which was wonderful. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

aka: Residence Inn Fort Myers Sanibel Hotel
